abstract.p: School officials close middle school in Kings Park, NY, after loaded handgun, apparently left during security training session, is found in bookbag (M)

block.p: School officials shut down a middle school in Suffolk County yesterday after a loaded handgun, apparently left during a security training session, was discovered in the building on Thursday night.

The gun, a .38-caliber Smith & Wesson, as well as a small container of gunpowder and some books, were in a book bag that had previously been hidden by a security company in a hallway of William T. Rogers Middle School in Kings Park during a canine training session authorized by the school district, the police said.
School officials shut down a middle school in Suffolk County yesterday after a loaded handgun, apparently left during a security training session, was discovered in the building on Thursday night.

The gun, a .38-caliber Smith & Wesson, as well as a small container of gunpowder and some books, were in a book bag that had previously been hidden by a security company in a hallway of William T. Rogers Middle School in Kings Park during a canine training session authorized by the school district, the police said.
The book bag was found about 6:30 p.m. behind a fire extinguisher in the hallway.

After an investigation, the police determined that the gun belonged to Michael Gould, an owner of Canine Consultants International, a private security firm that has a contract with the Kings Park School District. He is also an officer with the Nassau County police.
It was unclear last night when the most recent training session took place. The police said the owners of the security business were helping them determine when that was.
